trans-unit.source: Title: Windows build agents ms.TocTitle: Windows Description: Use Windows build agents to build your Windows and Azure code.
trans-unit.target: Title: Windows build agents ms.TocTitle: Windows Description: Use Windows build agents to build your Windows and Azure code.

trans-unit.source: toc: show ms.ContentId: 9FD46361-985B-4886-A042-9C322CE3CD92
trans-unit.target: toc: show ms.ContentId: 9FD46361-985B-4886-A042-9C322CE3CD92

trans-unit.source: Deploy an agent to build Windows and Azure apps
trans-unit.target: Deploy an agent to build Windows and Azure apps

trans-unit.source: To build Windows, Azure, and other Visual Studio solutions you'll need at least one Windows build agent.
trans-unit.target: To build Windows, Azure, and other Visual Studio solutions you'll need at least one Windows build agent.

trans-unit.source: Use the hosted pool on Visual Studio Online
trans-unit.target: Use the hosted pool on Visual Studio Online

trans-unit.source: Do you keep your code on Visual Studio Online?
trans-unit.target: Do you keep your code on Visual Studio Online?

trans-unit.source: If so, you might not need to set up a Windows build agent.
trans-unit.target: If so, you might not need to set up a Windows build agent.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Hosted pool</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Hosted pool</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you begin, make sure your build agent machine is set up with:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin, make sure your build agent machine is set up with:

trans-unit.source: An <linkText>operating system that is supported by Visual Studio 2013</linkText><title></title> or newer
trans-unit.target: An <linkText>operating system that is supported by Visual Studio 2013</linkText><title></title> or newer

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2013 or Visual Studio 2015
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2013 or Visual Studio 2015

trans-unit.source: PowerShell 3 or newer (<linkText>Where can I get a newer version of PowerShell?</linkText><title></title>)
trans-unit.target: PowerShell 3 or newer (<linkText>Where can I get a newer version of PowerShell?</linkText><title></title>)

trans-unit.source: If you are installing TFS, you get one build agent
trans-unit.target: If you are installing TFS, you get one build agent

trans-unit.source: When you install Team Foundation Server (TFS) on-premises, the wizard configures one agent.
trans-unit.target: When you install Team Foundation Server (TFS) on-premises, the wizard configures one agent.

trans-unit.source: Select the box if you want it to run automatically.
trans-unit.target: Select the box if you want it to run automatically.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Deploy a build agent when you install TFS</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Deploy a build agent when you install TFS</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Q: I was warned that my version of PowerShell is not sufficient to run the build agent.
trans-unit.target: Q: I was warned that my version of PowerShell is not sufficient to run the build agent.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Where can I get a newer version?</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Where can I get a newer version?</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Manually deploy a build agent
trans-unit.target: Manually deploy a build agent

trans-unit.source: You can add an on-premises build agent to your on-premises TFS or to your Visual Studio Online account.
trans-unit.target: You can add an on-premises build agent to your on-premises TFS or to your Visual Studio Online account.

trans-unit.source: Create a pool
trans-unit.target: Create a pool

trans-unit.source: Open your account (on-premises http://{your_server}:8080/tfs or Visual Studio Online https://{your_account}.visualstudio.com) in your web browser.
trans-unit.target: Open your account (on-premises http://{your_server}:8080/tfs or Visual Studio Online https://{your_account}.visualstudio.com) in your web browser.

trans-unit.source: Go to the control panel.
trans-unit.target: Go to the control panel.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Administer account</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Administer account</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Create a new pool.
trans-unit.target: Create a new pool.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New pool</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New pool</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create agent pool dialog box</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create agent pool dialog box</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Q: I'm having trouble working with our agent pools. What do I do?
trans-unit.target: Q: I'm having trouble working with our agent pools. What do I do?

trans-unit.source: A: Some common problems caused by permission issues include:
trans-unit.target: A: Some common problems caused by permission issues include:

trans-unit.source: Can't see agent pools.
trans-unit.target: Can't see agent pools.

trans-unit.source: Blocked by a permissions error when trying to create an agent pool.
trans-unit.target: Blocked by a permissions error when trying to create an agent pool.

trans-unit.source: Make sure you have permission to work with agent pools.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you have permission to work with agent pools.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Scale out and administer your build system</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Scale out and administer your build system</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Create a queue
trans-unit.target: Create a queue

trans-unit.source: Open a team project (on-premises http://{your_server}:8080/tfs/DefaultCollection/{your_project} or Visual Studio Online https://{your_account}.visualstudio.com/DefaultCollection/{your_project}) in your web browser.
trans-unit.target: Open a team project (on-premises http://{your_server}:8080/tfs/DefaultCollection/{your_project} or Visual Studio Online https://{your_account}.visualstudio.com/DefaultCollection/{your_project}) in your web browser.

trans-unit.source: Go to the control panel.
trans-unit.target: Go to the control panel.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Administer account</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Administer account</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Go to the collection settings and create a new queue.
trans-unit.target: Go to the collection settings and create a new queue.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New queue</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New queue</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create queue</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create queue</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Download and configure the agent
trans-unit.target: Download and configure the agent

trans-unit.source: On the machine where you are going to run the build agent, open a team project (on-premises http://{your_server}:8080/tfs/DefaultCollection/{your_project} or Visual Studio Online https://{your_account}.visualstudio.com/DefaultCollection/{your_project}) in your web browser.
trans-unit.target: On the machine where you are going to run the build agent, open a team project (on-premises http://{your_server}:8080/tfs/DefaultCollection/{your_project} or Visual Studio Online https://{your_account}.visualstudio.com/DefaultCollection/{your_project}) in your web browser.

trans-unit.source: Go to the control panel.
trans-unit.target: Go to the control panel.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Administer account</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Administer account</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Download the build agent software.
trans-unit.target: Download the build agent software.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Download agent</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Download agent</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Unzip the .zip file into the folder on disk from which you would like to run the agent.
trans-unit.target: Unzip the .zip file into the folder on disk from which you would like to run the agent.

trans-unit.source: To avoid long-path problems, keep the path as short as possible.
trans-unit.target: To avoid long-path problems, keep the path as short as possible.

trans-unit.source: For example: c:\agent\
trans-unit.target: For example: c:\agent\

trans-unit.source: Run PowerShell as Administrator.
trans-unit.target: Run PowerShell as Administrator.

trans-unit.source: Change to the directory where you unzipped the agent.
trans-unit.target: Change to the directory where you unzipped the agent.

trans-unit.source: .\ConfigureAgent.ps1
trans-unit.target: .\ConfigureAgent.ps1

trans-unit.source: Press Enter to use the default agent name.
trans-unit.target: Press Enter to use the default agent name.

trans-unit.source: Enter the URL:
trans-unit.target: Enter the URL:

trans-unit.source: Press Enter to use the default pool
trans-unit.target: Press Enter to use the default pool

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Q: How do I use pools to organize agents and maintain permission boundaries?</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Q: How do I use pools to organize agents and maintain permission boundaries?</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Press Enter.
trans-unit.target: Press Enter.

trans-unit.source: In most cases, enter Y to run the agent as a service.
trans-unit.target: In most cases, enter Y to run the agent as a service.

trans-unit.source: Enter N if you want to run the agent in interactive mode.
trans-unit.target: Enter N if you want to run the agent in interactive mode.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Q: Why would I want to run a build agent in interactive mode?</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Q: Why would I want to run a build agent in interactive mode?</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: If you are running the agent as a service, specify the user account.
trans-unit.target: If you are running the agent as a service, specify the user account.

trans-unit.source: In most cases you should press Enter.
trans-unit.target: In most cases you should press Enter.

trans-unit.source: If you specify a user account instead of using network service, then you are prompted for a user name and password.
trans-unit.target: If you specify a user account instead of using network service, then you are prompted for a user name and password.

trans-unit.source: Sign in as the user that owns the Visual Studio Online account or as an <linkText>agent pool administrator</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in as the user that owns the Visual Studio Online account or as an <linkText>agent pool administrator</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This user is only used during the configuration process.
trans-unit.target: This user is only used during the configuration process.

trans-unit.source: Once the agent is configured it will connect to the server or vso account using the specified <linkText>service account</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Once the agent is configured it will connect to the server or vso account using the specified <linkText>service account</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Choose the account to sign in</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Choose the account to sign in</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can verify that the agent is ready to go from the control panel.
trans-unit.target: You can verify that the agent is ready to go from the control panel.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Agents for pool default</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Agents for pool default</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Next step: Scale out and administer your build system
trans-unit.target: Next step: Scale out and administer your build system

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scale out and administer your build system</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scale out and administer your build system</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Q&A
trans-unit.target: Q&A

trans-unit.source: Why would I want to run a build agent in interactive mode?
trans-unit.target: Why would I want to run a build agent in interactive mode?

trans-unit.source: You can run build agent in interactive mode or as a service as mentioned above.
trans-unit.target: You can run build agent in interactive mode or as a service as mentioned above.

trans-unit.source: You can use interactive mode to:
trans-unit.target: You can use interactive mode to:

trans-unit.source: Run coded UI tests.
trans-unit.target: Run coded UI tests.

trans-unit.source: See what the build agent is doing in real time, for example to debug a problem in your build process.
trans-unit.target: See what the build agent is doing in real time, for example to debug a problem in your build process.

trans-unit.source: How do system capabilities work?
trans-unit.target: How do system capabilities work?

trans-unit.source: System capabilities are name/value pairs that you can use to ensure that your build definition is run only by build agents that meet criteria specified by you.
trans-unit.target: System capabilities are name/value pairs that you can use to ensure that your build definition is run only by build agents that meet criteria specified by you.

trans-unit.source: Environment variables automatically appear in the list.
trans-unit.target: Environment variables automatically appear in the list.

trans-unit.source: Some capabilities (such as .Net frameworks) are also added automatically.
trans-unit.target: Some capabilities (such as .Net frameworks) are also added automatically.

trans-unit.source: You can also manually add capabilities to the list.
trans-unit.target: You can also manually add capabilities to the list.

trans-unit.source: When a build is queued, the system sends the job only to agents that have the capabilities demanded by the build definition.
trans-unit.target: When a build is queued, the system sends the job only to agents that have the capabilities demanded by the build definition.

trans-unit.source: Can I still configure and use XAML build controllers and agents?
trans-unit.target: Can I still configure and use XAML build controllers and agents?

trans-unit.source: Yes.
trans-unit.target: Yes.

trans-unit.source: If you are an existing customer with custom build processes you are not yet ready to migrate, you can continue to use XAML builds, controllers, and agents.
trans-unit.target: If you are an existing customer with custom build processes you are not yet ready to migrate, you can continue to use XAML builds, controllers, and agents.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure XAML build controllers and agents</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure XAML build controllers and agents</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Where is the guidance about the XAML builds?
trans-unit.target: Where is the guidance about the XAML builds?

trans-unit.source: <linkText>MSDN: Build the application</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>MSDN: Build the application</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: What's the name of the service?
trans-unit.target: What's the name of the service?

trans-unit.source: If you run the agent as a service, it is named: "VSO Agent (<name of your agent>)".
trans-unit.target: If you run the agent as a service, it is named: "VSO Agent (<name of your agent>)".
